content.description: The Wedding Chapel, continued from last season. Chandler and Monica are about to get married.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! (Stands up) This is it! (Claps his hands) We’re gonna get married!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you sure you wanna do this?
(Suddenly the doors burst open, and Ross AND Rachel COME OUT ARM-IN-ARM!!!!! And Rachel’s carrying a bouquet!!! THEY GOT MARRIED!!!!)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, hello, Mrs. Ross! (Throws some rice.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, hello, Mr. Rachel! (Throws some more rice.)
(They storm out into the street.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait! (Gets her bearings) Okay!
(She goes one way; he goes the other. The camera pans back to Chandler and Monica, and needless to say, they’re standing there dumbstruck.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whoa!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on Pheebs! Hurry! Hurry! Hurry! Hurry!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! Okay! Okay! (They run into the chapel.)
(Chandler and Monica are stunned again.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!! Is everybody getting married?!!
(Phoebe and Joey run back out and head towards the street.)

content.speaker: Attendant
content.text: N-No running in the chapel!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Don’t you give me any of your—Hey! (Sees Chandler and Monica standing there.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you guys doing here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross and Rachel left us a message saying they were getting married! Isn’t that why you guys are here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! Well that-yes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why else would we be here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well! What happened?! Did we miss it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We actually missed it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, maybe you wouldn’t have had you (turns to the attendant) run in the chapel !

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is insane!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s the big deal, y’know? It’s not like it’s a real marriage.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, if you get married in Vegas, you’re only married in Vegas.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you talking about? If you get married in Vegas you’re married everywhere.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!—Eh! Well…

{Transciber’s note: In case you haven’t heard, Courteney Cox got married to David Arquette during hiatus and changed her name to Courteney Cox Arquette. But David was a busy boy during the off season for not only did he marry but everyone else as well. For they’re all listed as Jennifer Aniston Arquette, Lisa Kudrow Arquette, in an interesting twist Matt LeBlanc Arquette, Matthew Perry Arquette, David Schwimmer Arquette, and even the creators of the show are now David Crane Arquette and Marta Kauffman Arquette. I just wonder what the new sleeping arrangements are…}

content.description: Rachel’s hotel room, she’s waking up with a horrendous hangover.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh! (Looks in the mirror and sees that she still has her mustache and groans.)
(Suddenly, there’s movement beside her, startling her. It’s Ross! He wakes up and they both start screaming in terror. Then they both grab their heads having aggravated their hangovers.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why are we in bed together?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. Do-do you have any clothes on?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! But we-we didn’t have…sex-uh, did we? I mean, I don’t remember much about last night, it was such a blur.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! I remember laughing! I laughed a lot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And we didn’t have sex.
(Rachel agrees with him and starts to get out of bed.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, I mean, we were really drunk. I’m just glad we didn’t do anything stupid.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Tell me about it. (He sits up on the edge of the bed and has “Just Married” written on his back.)

content.description: The breakfast buffet, Phoebe is already sitting at the table as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mornin’ Pheebs. (Sits down.) Well, my movie has officially been canceled.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh Joey, I’m so sorry. You want some of my breakfast?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nah, I’m too depressed to eat. I’ll probably eat in like 5 minutes. So I guess I’ll just fly home with you guys, what time’s your flight?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What about my cab?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t need that anymore.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, Joey! You borrowed my cab; you have to drive it back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t want to drive all the way back by myself, I get so lonely. (Gets an idea.) Oh—ooh! How about you come with me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know, it’s such a long trip.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’ll be great! We-we could talk, and play games! Huh? This could be our chance to like renew our friendship.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you asking me to have a frenaissance?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. Although I don’t think we need one, I never stopped loving you.
(Chandler and Monica enter.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, has anyone talked to Dr. and Mrs. Geller yet?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um-hmm, yeah. They left me a message; they should be here any minute.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Where is the waitress?! I’m starving!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a buffet man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, here’s where I win all my money back! (Gets up and heads for the buffet table with Chandler in tow.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen, I gotta talk to you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure! What’s up? (He grabs a plate and proceeds to load it with a huge pile of scrambled eggs. Chandler just stares at him and Joey reluctantly gives him a spoonful.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica and I almost got married last night.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! That’s huge! (Hugs him.) Wait a minute, why come I wasn’t invited? And who was going to be your best man? Don’t say, “Ross.” Do not say, “Ross.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I just don’t think Monica and I are ready to get married yet! Y’know? I mean, I love her and everything but seeing Ross and Rachel coming out of that chapel was like a, like a wake-up call that Monica and I are moving so fast. Y’know? And, how do I tell her without crushing her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! Tell her she’s not marriage material.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Girls say it to me all the time! And believe me, if she’s anything like me, she’s just gonna be relieved.
[Pan to Monica and Phoebe having the same conversation.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How do I tell Chandler that it’s too soon. It’s gonna break his heart, he’s not gonna think that I don’t love him anymore.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well you don’t.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes I do!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good! Good! I was just testing you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh hi! Hi! Y’know, we were just talking about bacon.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, we were talking about tennis. Tennis is more believable.
(Ross and Rachel enter.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: The Girls
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!
(They both sit down and Rachel pours them both some coffee. They’re acting like nothing’s happened and everyone is just staring at them.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are we gonna talk about what you guys did last night? Or…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. (To the gang.) What do you mean last night? Nothing, nothing uh, happened last night.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh! Ross invited us all to watch.
(Rachel turns to Ross stunned.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach! We weren’t gonna miss our friends getting married!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who got married?! (Ross is as surprised to hear this as she is.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You did.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! Hello! We didn’t get married.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, we didn’t get married! That’s ridiculous!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We-we-we—I remember being in a chapel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I—They would not let us get married when we were that drunk!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They let you get married when you’re drunk! Most people who get married in Vegas are drunk!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hell, I’m drunk right now! (They all turn and look at her.) What? I can’t have a mimosa with breakfast?! I’m on vacation!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you guys gonna do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I guess we just find a divorce lawyer? (Looks at Ross.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I think, I think, Ross already has one. Now, this one’s free, right? Because you paid for the first two, so the third one’s free.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Laugh it up, but the joke’s on you. Because we don’t need to get divorced, okay? We we’re just gonna get an annulment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: An annulment? Ross! I don’t think surgery’s the answer here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh-oh, that’s your thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re thing. You’re thing. Y’know? You’re the guy who gets divorced.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no, that’s-that’s not my thing! I do not love getting divorced!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes you do! This is your third divorce! You love divorce so much you’re probably gonna marry it! Then it won’t work out and you’re gonna have to divorce it, divorcing guy. (Pause) I’m so drunk.

content.description: The casino floor, Chandler and Monica are walking through it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, what do you think we should do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know. But I-I-I know I love you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know I love you! (They hug.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So where are we on the whole going back to the place where they have all the marriages thing? I love you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s a good question. Look umm, last night we let the dice decide. Maybe we should leave it up to fate again. I love you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, we don’t get married unless there’s a sign! Okay, so say uh, say you roll another eight (motions to the craps table) then there’s a definite sign that we should get married.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, eight we get married, but 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12 we don’t get married.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sounds great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (They approach the craps table.)

content.speaker: Croupler
content.text: Coming in, we got a shooter! Money please.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ready?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ready!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on eight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, yes eight.
(Monica rolls the dice.)

content.speaker: Croupler
content.text: Eight! Easy eight. (She rolls a 3 and a 5 and they’re stunned.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! I can’t believe I actually rolled an eight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was so unlikely. Well, let’s get married! I guess.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute. That wasn’t a hard eight! Last night I rolled a hard eight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s right! It was the wrong kind of eight, no wedding! Damnit!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wanted it so bad! (Pause) Wanna go pack?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. (They go pack.) We’re doing the right thing, right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, of course we are! (They walk up to the elevators.) We left it up to fate. (Pushes the elevator button.) If we were supposed to get married there would be a clear-cut sign. (The elevator door opens to a priest reading from a bible with Chandler and Monica standing side-by-side holding each other’s hands.)

content.description: Phoebe’s cab, Phoebe and Joey are driving back. Phoebe is driving while Joey is sleeping.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, you have 19 questions left. Use them wisely. (Joey groans.) Come on Joey! You can’t win if you don’t ask any (sees that he’s asleep) QUESTIONS !!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, you promised me a fun road trip! We’ve been on the road six hours and you’ve been asleep for five and a half! We are switching at the next rest stop and you are going to drive all the way back! That will be your punishment, you greedy sleeper!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. All right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! And until then you are going to sing to me because the radio’s broken and you are selfish but have a nice voice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? I don’t…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sing!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I wanna rock and roll all night ! (Falls asleep.)
[Time lapse, Phoebe is asleep, Joey’s driving and having a hard time staying awake.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, this is a long drive! Are my eyes open? No! (He opens his eyes and sees a hitchhiker.)
[Time lapse, Phoebe is still asleep only Joey is now passed out next to her and the car’s still moving. She wakes up, sees Joey, and screams.]

content.speaker: Hitchhiker
content.text: Morning! (Phoebe screams again.)

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is on the couch as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, hubby!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, actually um, I wanted to talk to you about that whole annulment thing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m not going to do that. (Rachel glares at him.)

content.description: Central Perk, continued from earlier. Rachel starts laughing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! So, we’ll just stay married.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, exactly!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And I will make everyone call me Mrs. Geller!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! This is so amazing. I uh, I really thought I’d have to talk you into this more.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, see now I’m scared because I don’t actually think you’re kidding.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m-I’m not kidding. Look I-I, I can’t have three failed marriages. I can’t. Okay? I-I am not gonna be that guy!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What-wh-what so we’ll just stay married forever?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, look, how is this gonna affect you? Really? I mean you fill some form out once and a while and instead of checking the box that says Ms you check the box that says Mrs.! It’s right next to it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, okay, I’m sorry. You’re right. Y’know what? We absolutely can stay married, because I was under the impression that the boxes were far away from each other. All right, look, just please, take a moment here and think about what you’re asking of me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m asking you to do me a favor.
{Note: Does anyone else want to smack Ross right about now? Raise your hands. Okay, put them down before you stink out the person next to you.}

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You are asking me to be your wife!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And as my wife I think you should grant me this favor.

content.description: The hallway, Chandler is helping Monica to the door.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That kid really kicked me hard on the plane.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well you did pull his hair.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He took my snack!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not getting into this again!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! Oh God, y’know what? It’s really bad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I told you not to walk. Here. (Picks her up.) There. Okay. (He opens the door, carries her across the threshold, stops, backs out, and lets go of Monica who is only holding on by his neck.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This doesn’t mean anything, does it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.description: Phoebe’s cab, she’s driving, Joey’s in the back seat, and the hitchhiker is riding up front with Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How could you pick up a hitchhiker?! He could be a rape—(She holds her hand in front of the hitchhiker’s face), a rapist or a killer or something!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t you think I asked him that before he got in?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know what? I’m not talking to you! You go back to sleep! (To the hitchhiker) And you, are you a rapist?!

content.speaker: Hitchhiker
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do you like car games?

content.speaker: Hitchhiker
content.text: Yeah, y’know the license plate game?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I love the license plate game!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, I’ll play! I’ll play!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-No! You need your sleep. Night-night! Shh! (She closes the partition.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is entering.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen, I know you wanted to talk to me, but I have an idea that may make you want to stay married. (Rachel shakes her head.) We register, and you get to keep all the presents!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Ross, come on! No! Listen, look I thought a lot about how to tell you this and the bottom line, Ross, is we can not stay married.
content.parenthetical: thinks about it for a second

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know if it’s true.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh b-b-but it is!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, okay, y’know what this is? This is a difference of opinion. And when that happens in a marriage…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Ross, come on! This is not, this is not a marriage!! This is the world’s worst hangover! Ross, listen, if you do not get this annulment, I will!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. All right, I’ll do it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. (He goes to leave.) Hey-hey umm, uh, is there, is there any such thing as an annulment shower?
(Ross turns and leaves.)

content.description: Phoebe’s cab, it’s the same arrangement as before.

content.speaker: Hitchhiker
content.text: Wait! Wait! There is the train station!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay.

content.speaker: Hitchhiker
content.text: This is where I get off. Well, I have your address and phone number.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And I have your name and the fact that you’re a drifter, so the ball’s pretty much in your court.

content.speaker: Hitchhiker
content.text: All right, see ya Pheebs. (Gets out and Phoebe drives away.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on Pheebs! I can’t take this anymore! Let-let me make it up to you. Huh? (Starts singing.) Ground control to Major Tom. Commencing countdown, engines on. Take your protein pills and put your helmet on !

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Stop it! Stop it no! That’s not fair! Y’know I can’t resist that beautiful voice!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs, I am so sorry! I know I promised you a fun road trip with your friend and I didn’t deliver. But-but-but now I know that you think being awake is an important part of friendship! So, so, so I will strive to-to stay awake for as long as I know you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You can still sleep at night and stuff.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, thank you. So, can we play 20 Questions now? I’ve got a really good one! I’ve been thinking about it since Kansas.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Is it a kind of hot sandwich?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Is it a meatball sub?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That is incredible! You are the master!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler and Monica are there and Rachel is arranging a bouquet of flowers, pricks her finger on a thorn, throws the bouquet over her head, and those you who are quicker than some already know that Monica is the one who catches it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh, that’s funny. You look like you’re gonna be the…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, don’t say it! Don’t even think it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right. Okay Chandler, enjoy your handful. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, should we just, should we just get married? Y’know? I mean should we just do it? All the signs are telling us to do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sick of the signs! It’s too fast, I’m happy the way things are!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Me too!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t want things to change! Do you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right then, then nothing changes! Everything is great! Everything stays the same! And you go unpack because it’s been three days and it’s driving me insane!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Jeez, relax! It’s not like we’re mar-ah-ah!! (Runs out.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know I was thinking, what if I uh, unpack here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then all your stuff would be here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, what if all my stuff was here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then you’d be going back and forth all the time, I mean it doesn’t make any sense.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. What if we lived together and you understand what I’m saying?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Live together? There have been no signs for that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Me asking is kind of a sign.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!!!!!
(And the crowd goes wild! Well, at least the live studio audience.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! Okay! Okay! Wait-wait-wait!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here’s your key (Gets him one.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh thanks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here’s your key. All right, you have to christen it! Now, go out and come back in!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The door hasn’t been locked in five years, but okay! (Runs out.) Ready?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ready!
(He tries, but something happens.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, a little problem. The key broke in the lock and I can’t get in!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait! Oh my God! I can’t get out!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is not a sign!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, it’s not a sign! It’s a very old key!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s an old key!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God it’s old!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I love you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you hugging the door right now.
(Pause)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah-yeah, me neither.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are on the couch as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, so did everything go all right with the annulment?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, yeah, no problems. It’s all taken care of.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, thank you. Hey, do you guys wanna go see a movie?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah, why not?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No thanks, I’ve already seen one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, umm, I’m gonna get my sweater. (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (Sits down next to Phoebe.) You uh, you wanna hear something weird?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Always.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I didn’t get the annulment.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re still married! Don’t tell Rachel. See you later. (He gets up leaving Phoebe in shock.)

content.description: The hallway, Joey is coming up the stairs and sees Chandler trying to open the lock.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The key’s stuck in the lock.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can fix it. Hold on. (He goes and gets a screwdriver from his apartment) Look out. Look out. (Pries at the door a little bit.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It still doesn’t work.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m not finished.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh.
(Joey goes back into the apartment, runs back into the hallway, throws his shoulder against the door, and knocks it down off it’s hinges.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nice job Joe! You’re quite the craftsmen.
(Joey pats him on the stomach and heads to bed.)
